examples: there's a new brand of hero in the movies now
what make of car is that?

definitions.text: the act of mixing cards haphazardly

examples: He made a fool of himself at the meeting
Don't make this into a big deal
This invention will make you a millionaire

definitions.text: make or cause to be or to become
examples: make a mess in one's office

definitions.text: cause to do; cause to act in a specified manner
examples: The ads induced me to buy a VCR
My children finally got me to buy a computer
My wife made me buy a new sofa

definitions.text: give rise to; cause to happen or occur, not always intentionally
create or manufacture a man-made product
examples: We produce more cars than we can sell
The company has been making toys for two centuries

definitions.text: make, formulate, or derive in the mind
examples: What do you make of his remarks?

definitions.text: compel or make somebody or something to act in a certain way
examples: People cannot be made to integrate just by passing a law!

definitions.text: earn on some commercial or business transaction; earn as salary or wages
examples: How much do you make a month in your new job?
She earns a lot in her new job
this merger brought in lots of money

definitions.text: create or design, often in a certain way
examples: I did this piece in wood to express my love for the forest
This wall forms the background of the stage setting
She may not make the grade

definitions.text: be or be capable of being changed or made into
examples: He will make a fine father

definitions.text: make by shaping or bringing together constituents
make by combining materials and parts
examples: this little pig made his house out of straw
Some eccentric constructed an electric brassiere warmer

definitions.text: change from one form into another
act in a certain way so as to acquire
charge with a function; charge to be
examples: She was named Head of the Committee
She was made president of the club

definitions.text: reach a destination, either real or abstract
examples: We barely made it to the finish line
I have to hit the MAC machine before the weekend starts

definitions.text: form by assembling individuals or constituents

examples: have, throw, or make a party
The escaped convict took to the hills
The dog had made in the flower beds
This wool makes into a nice sweater
This salary increase makes no difference to my standard of living
He made to speak but said nothing in the end
She made as if to say hello to us
work one's way through the crowd
make one's way into the forest

definitions.text: gather and light the materials for
prepare for eating by applying heat
examples: can you make me an omelette?
fix breakfast for the guests, please
A good review by this critic will make your play!

definitions.text: represent fictitiously, as in a play, or pretend to be or act like

examples: It wasn't the problem some people made it
I make the height about 100 feet

definitions.text: cause to be enjoyable or pleasurable

examples: He will make a splendid father!
Again, the cat had made on the expensive rug
